subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Tim Clark of South Africa needed one birdie in the final two holes to become the first non-American golfer to shoot a round of 59 on the PGA Tour. But instead, Clark bogeyed the final two holes and settled for a 62.
snippet: Tim Clark of South Africa needed one birdie in the final two holes to become the first non-American golfer to shoot a round of 59 on the PGA Tour. But instead, Clark bogeyed the final two holes and settled for a 62.
